Package assegnamento2

Class Store

java.lang.Object
assegnamento2.Store
public class Store
extends java.lang.Object
The class Store manages the Wine Shop through methods that work on the inner data structures.

It contains lists of wines, clients, sellers and orders.

notifRequest holds the requests of restock notifications made by the users.

currSeller and currClient hold the currently logged in user (Client and Sellers cannot be simultaneously logged in).

NOTE:

This implementation does not allow for multiple users logged in simultaneously.

Modifications are required in case multiple users have to be served in parallel.

A possible solution would be to pass the user/seller id to each method to allow for authentication and logging.

      private java.util.ArrayList<Wine> wineList
      List of wines owned by the shop.

      private java.util.ArrayList<Order> orderList
      List of orders from clients.

    • userList

      private java.util.ArrayList<LoggableUser> userList
      List of LoggableUsers of the system. Both Clients and Sellers are stored here.

    • notifRequest

      private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer>> notifRequest
      Map of notification requests.

      - Wine ID

      - Client ID

      - Amount of bottles

  • Constructor Details

    • Store

      public Store()
      Class Constructor.

      It sets up an initial list of Wines available in the Store, some registered Clients, and one Seller.

  • Method Details

    • logout

      private void logout()
      Logs out the currently logged-in user by setting to null currClient and currSeller.

    • contains

      private <T> boolean contains​(java.util.ArrayList<T> list, T obj)
      Generic method that returns whether an object is included in a list based on the string representation.

      It allows to check if a list contains an object without having to match the object's memory address (it only confronts inner data).

      Type Parameters:
      T - Any data type. Specifically used with Wines and LoggableUsers
      Parameters:
      list - the list in which to search the object.
      obj - the object to find in the list.
      Returns:
      true if the object is found, false otherwise.

    • alreadyRegistered

      private boolean alreadyRegistered​(LoggableUser usr)
      Checks if a user has already been registered into the store.
      Parameters:
      usr - user to be registered.
      Returns:
      true if already existing, false otherwise.

    • get

      private <T> T get​(java.util.ArrayList<T> list, T obj)
      Generic method that returns the object reference contained in the specified list of the specified object.

      It allows to retrieve an object without having to match the object's memory address by confronting the inner data.

      Employs the contains method to check if a suitable match is found.

      If no matching object is found, it returns null.

      Type Parameters:
      T - Any data type. Specifically used with Wines and LoggableUsers
      Parameters:
      list - the list in which to search the object.
      obj - the object to find in the list.
      Returns:
      the object if found, or null.

    • getWineByID

      private Wine getWineByID​(int wineId)
      It retrieves the Wine that matches the specified id.
      Parameters:
      wineId - the id of the wine to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      the wine if found, null otherwise.

    • getClientByID

      private Client getClientByID​(int clientId)
      It retrieves the Client that matches the specified id.

      Parameters:
      clientId - the id of the client to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      the client if found, null otherwise.

    • register

      public void register​(LoggableUser usr)
      It allows the registration of a new LoggableUser to the Store.

      Parameters:
      usr - the client or seller to be registered.

    • addWine

      public void addWine​(Wine w)
      Adds a wine to the wineList.

      Precondition: a seller is logged in. If a seller is logged in it check if the wine you want to add is in wineList.

      If the wine passed as parameter is not in the list it is added to the wineList e added a wineId.

      If it is already present in the list, the number of bottles is updated.

      Parameters:
      w - the wine you want to add to the wineList.

    • restockWine

      public void restockWine​(int wineId, int extraN)
      Restocks extraN numbers of bottles of the specified wine.

      Precondition: a seller is logged in.

      Parameters:
      wineId - id of the wine to be restocked.
      extraN - number of bottles to be added.

    • login

      public boolean login​(java.lang.String email, java.lang.String password)
      It allows the login of a LoggableUser to the Store.

      It logs out any previous logged-in user.

      Parameters:
      email - the user's email.
      password - the user's password.
      Returns:
      true if email and password are correct, false otherwise.

    • displayWines

      public void displayWines()
      Displays all the wines.

      Precondition: there are clients or sellers logged in.

      If there are any, it prints to the standard output the list, otherwise displays an error message.

    • displayWines

      public void displayWines​(java.lang.String searchText, SearchType searchType)
      Displays only the wines that match the specified query.

      Precondition: there are clients or sellers logged in.

      It employs the search method and therefore allows to show all the wines that match a specified name or year.

      Parameters:
      searchText - text to be searched
      searchType - type of search (YEAR, NAME, ID)

    • search

      private java.util.ArrayList<Wine> search​(java.lang.String searchText, SearchType searchType)
      Searches by Year or Name or ID through the list of wines.
      Parameters:
      searchText - text to be searched for
      searchType - type of search
      Returns:
      list of wines that match the query

    • buy

      public boolean buy​(int wineId, int amount, boolean requestIfNotAvailable)
      Sells amount bottles of the wine specified by the wineId to the currently logged-in client.

      Precondition: a client is logged in.

      Parameters:
      wineId - id of the wine to be bought
      amount - amount of bottles to be bought
      requestIfNotAvailable - express willingness to be notified in case of the absence of the needed amount
      Returns:
      true if the wine is available to be bought, false otherwise.

    • requestWine

      private void requestWine​(int wineId, int clientId, int amount)
      A notify is sent to to the seller, so that he knows which wine needs to be restocked, and which client did the order.
      Parameters:
      wineId - the id of the wine that allows to uniquely identify it.
      clientId - the id of the person that allows to uniquely identify him.
      amount - the numbers of bottles requested.
